labels.analysis: The MCP Server described as "Mistral OCR" focuses on processing images and PDFs using advanced OCR (Optical Character Recognition) technology. It provides tools to convert local files or files from URLs into structured JSON outputs, leveraging Mistral AI's capabilities. The core functionality revolves around document processing and text extraction from various file types, automating the conversion of unstructured documents into machine-readable formats.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Document Processing" reflects the server's main purpose of extracting and structuring text from documents. While "Data Analysis & Processing" could apply due to the conversion to JSON, it is secondary as the primary use case is document conversion. "Web Search & Research" is not directly applicable, though URL processing may sometimes relate to research. The custom label "OCR" is included to highlight the specific technology used, as it is a niche but central functionality.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@everaldo/mcp-mistral-ocr/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
